meanings.definition: A type of fabric used for clothing.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful dress made of gabbard to the party.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used soft gabbard to make the shirt.
meanings.sent3: The gabbard material felt like a cozy hug.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was a colorful sea of gabbard.
meanings.sent5: The gabbard fabric shimmered under the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The teacher gabbarded the students for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent2: She tends to gabbard whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: He gabbarded the mischievous puppy for chewing his shoes.
meanings.sent4: The boss gabbarded the employees for their lack of productivity.
meanings.sent5: The coach gabbarded the team for their poor performance.

meanings.definition: A type of boat used in the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen relied on their sturdy gabbard to navigate the river.
meanings.sent2: The gabbard gracefully sailed across the calm waters.
meanings.sent3: The gabbard bobbed gently on the waves like a floating home.
meanings.sent4: The ancient gabbard was a symbol of tradition and craftsmanship.
meanings.sent5: The crew worked together to repair the worn-out gabbard.
